alert.note: Alert for Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:54PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western DeSoto, northeastern Tunica and northwestern Tate Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 554 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phillipp, or 14 miles southwest of Hernando, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hernando, Walls, Lake Cormorant, Arkabutla, Phillipp, Eudora, Lynchburg, Robinson Gin, Newport, Trinity, Dooley, Twin Lakes, Frees Corners, Nesbit, West Days, Lost Lake, Prichard, Glover, Banks and Penton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
